intro: Primulina lianpingensis, commonly known as the Lianping stone fern, is a rare and unique plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, creeping rhizomes and compact, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows on rocky surfaces or in shaded, humid environments, showcasing its adaptation to specific ecological niches. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a leathery texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare species of conservation interest.
